metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4966 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Ansible before 1.6.7 does not prevent inventory data with "{{" and "lookup" substrings, and does not prevent remote data with "{{" substrings, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) crafted lookup('pipe') calls or (2) crafted Jinja2 data. It was discovered that Ansible mishandled certain input. A remote attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: ansible: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
